lines.text: "There are no good or bad people, only souls chasing their own desires. And sometimes, the only thing standing in their way... is humanity itself."
Greytear City, the city of ambition and luxury, where people are willing to sell their own kin just to fulfill their desires.

As a city situated between the borders of three countries, it is the home to all kinds of people: from the wealthy, who use money to bend the law as they see fit, to the poor, who leave their hometowns in pursuit of feeding their families.
The city promises all, but also takes all, regardless of who you are.
The city promises all, but also takes all, regardless of who you are. With its Victorian architecture and rows of neatly packed houses, it is a nest for criminals to thrive under the night’s veil.
Still, in a small corner of Greytear, one place remains open, its dim yellow light flickering in the night like the ray of sunshine right after a heavy rain.
It wasn’t because he hated the dull atmosphere, which was amplified by the sound of raindrops gently brushing against the windows.
No, he was waiting for something… something that even his heart had yet to recognize.
